record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, JULY 9, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. Monday, July 9; that on Monday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time of the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business until 3 p.m., with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees; that at 3 p.m., the Senate proceed to consideration of H.R. 1585, as provided under a previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
